articles.title: Dust of dead Earth-like planets found in atmospheres white dwarfs - Daily Mail
articles.description: The dust of dead Earth-like planets has been discovered in the atmosphere of nearby white dwarfs for the first time. The vaporized crusts consist of lithium, potassium and calcium.
articles.content:
The dust of dead Earth-like planets has been observed in the atmosphere of four nearby white dwarfs, the core of a dead star that is comparable to that of our sun.
A team from the University of Warw… [+5376 chars]
